intro: Parosela anthonyi, commonly known as the Anthony's parosela, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Parosela anthonyi is considered a vulnerable species.
